alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 5:34AM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Pineville affecting Bell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Pineville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 1006.4 feet, Fourmile Road floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 999.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 1006.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 1002.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1006.9 feet on 03/28/1994. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued by 4 PM EST.
